powergrid.control.uicontrols

Class Quests

  • java.lang.Object
    • powergrid.control.uicontrols.Quests

  • public abstract class Quests
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with checking the status of Quests and as such can be used to check requirements for various tasks.

    Quest names are case-insensitive, and can be given with either underscores or spaces. Any special characters like apostrophes and such cannot be omitted, but should either be included or replaced by underscores.

      • status

        public static final java.lang.String[] status
        contains the String values for the statuses. The String-value of a status is equal to status[status]. For example, status[COMPLETED] contains the String "Completed".

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quests

        public Quests()

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public static int getStatus(java.lang.String quest)
        Returns the Status of the Quest with the given name.

        This method returns either Quests.NOT_STARTED, Quests.STARTED, or Quests.COMPLETED, depending on the status of the Quest.

        When no Quest with the given name is found, this method throws a NoSuchElementException.

        Parameters:
        quest - the name of the quest
        Returns:
        the status of the quest, or UNAVAILABLE if the Quest is not registered.

      • isCompleted

        public static boolean isCompleted(java.lang.String quest)
        Returns true if the player has completed the given Quest.

        When no Quest with the given name is found, this method throws a NoSuchElementException.

        Parameters:
        quest - the name of the quest
        Returns:
        true if the player has completed the given quest, false otherwise.

      • isStarted

        public static boolean isStarted(java.lang.String quest)
        Returns true if the player has started, but no completed the given Quest.

        When no Quest with the given name is found, this method throws a NoSuchElementException.

        Parameters:
        quest - the name of the quest
        Returns:
        true if the player has started the given quest but has yet to complete it, false otherwise.

      • isUnstarted

        public static boolean isUnstarted(java.lang.String quest)
        Returns true if the player has not yet started the given Quest.

        When no Quest with the given name is found, this method throws a NoSuchElementException.

        Parameters:
        quest - the name of the quest
        Returns:
        true if the player has not yet started the given quest, false otherwise.

      • updateQuestData

        public static void updateQuestData()
        Reloads the Quest information from the environment. When the PowerWalk plug-in is loaded, the Quest data was loaded when PowerWalk started. Otherwise, this method needs to be called before any information on Quests can be collected.

        This method must be manually called to reflect changes to the status of Quests after PowerWalk is loaded. A feasible way to do this is to assign a Task to the Bot class with the lowest priority. The Bot will then update the caches automatically when there is nothing else to do.

        Note that this method involves opening and closing the Noticeboard, and may therefore take around 3-4 seconds to complete.

      • getAllQuests

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllQuests()
        returns a Set containing all loaded names for Quests.
        Returns:
        a Set containing all Quest names.
